intro: Solenandra elliptica subsp. elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leafed solenandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asparagaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly in Queensland and New South Wales. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Solenandra elliptica subsp. elliptica is a perennial herb that is well adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native range.
